_header: A knight there was in England by north here beside
Subjects: Virgin Mary, miracles of; miracles; miracles
_description: The Oxford Scholar, a miracle of the Virgin, in the South English Legendary — in couplets

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
A Knight þer was in engelond bi norþ here bisideA
                    ȝong child he hadd bi his wif As god wolde it sholde
                    bitide…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Þe miracle was þo hold soþ of þis holy
                    childeWiþ eche thing alday we seoþ oure lady suete &
                    mylde
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

OxfTri57.First Lines:
A knyȝt þer was in Engelonde by fore her be sydeA
                    ȝong child he hadde by his wyf as god wolde it sholde be
                    tyde…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…Þe meracle was þo i holde soth of þis holy
                    childewith eche þyng al day we seþ oure Leuedy swete and
                    mylde

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
A knyght þer was in Ingland þat dwelled in þe north
                    sideA knafe childe he had with his wyfe als god wolde þat tideHis
                    modre a day when he was ȝonge þis childe to kirke sho
                    broghtÞis childe in þe kirke behelde þe rode &
                    þeron he had grete thoght…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Þus was þis miracle proued sothe of þis ilk
                    childeBlissed mot þat lady be þat is bothe meke &
                    mylde

CamCCC145.First Lines:
A kniȝt þer was in engelonde by northe here bisideA
                    ȝong sone he hadde bi his wyf as god wolde it ssolde
                    bitide…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Þe miracle was þo iholde soþ of þis holy
                    childeWiþ ech þing alday we seoþ oure leuedi swete &
                    milde
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 235.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
A Kniȝt þer was in Engelonde by Northþe her by sydeA
                    ȝong sone he hadde by his wyf as god wolde so hit more by
                    tyde…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Þe miracle was yholde soþ of þis goede
                    childeWiþ eche þing al day we seoþ þat oure lady swete
                    is & mylde

CamTCC605.First Lines:
A knyȝt þer was in englonde by norþe here by sydeA
                    ȝong sone he hadde by his wyf as hit dude bytyde…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…þe myracle was þo yholde soþ of þis holy
                    chyldeIn eche þing we sey þat oure leuedy is swete &
                    mylde

Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
A kniȝt þer was in engelonde by norþe here by sydeA
                    ȝong sone he hadde by is wif as god wolde it solde
                    bitide…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…Þe miracle was þo i holde soþ of þis holy
                    childeWn eche þing al day we seþ oure lady swete &

BLCottCleoDIX.First Lines:
[A] kniȝte þer was in engelond bi norþe here bi
                    sideA ȝonge sone he hadde bi his wif as god wolde hit scolde bi
                    tide…
BLCottCleoDIX.Last Lines:
…Þe miracle was þo iholde soþ of þis holi
                    childWiþ ech þinge al dai we seoþ oure leuedi swete &
                    mild
BLCottCleoDIX.Note:
Folio number reflects the most recent foliation. Space left for enlarged
                    ‘A’, which was left blank.

BLEge2891.First Lines: …Ech mon amorwe bote hi tweie wende hom mis endeffelawe quaþ þat on it is tyme þat we þe tapres tende…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …þe miracle was þo holde soþ of þis holy childeWan ech þing alday we seoþ oure leuedi swete & milde
BLEge2891.Note: Begins incomplete at top of folio, lacking lines 1-40.

BLHar2277.First Lines: A kniȝt þer was in Engelond by norþe her bisideA ȝung child he hadde bi his wyf as god wolde hit scholde bitide…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …þe Miracle was þo iholde soþ of þis holi childeWiþ eche þing alday we seoþ oure leuedi suete & mylde
BLHar2277.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2277.

Tryon,  Ruth Wilson. 
             “Miracles of Our Lady in Middle English Verse.” 
             PMLA
         38 (1923): 308-81: 319-20.
